name: places/ChIJX_Dug3hZwokRBxEQ_nWT2u4
formattedAddress: 228 E 3rd St #1, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 228 E 3rd St #1, New York, NY 10009-7585, USA

originalText.text:
I don't usually leave reviews and I don't even know if this will have an impact, but as a tenant for 10+ years, I am overwhelmed by the amount of issues I have experienced living here. There are problems with every aspect; including the staff, maintenance, safety, cleanliness, etc. It feels like I am living in a tenement from the 1800s.
- Elevator is broken several times a month; repair after repair and the problem still exists. I've seen some tenants have to carry their bikes up the stairs, and other older tenants who stand there helplessly and stare at the broken elevator. I am too ashamed to invite guests over or order food delivery because I fear that they will get stuck in the elevator.
- The turnover rate for the superintendent position is too high. It seems to be a different person every year! Do not expect the super to follow up with you on your maintenance inquires because he is probably no longer working. I don't even know who my current super is. Furthermore, the super rarely responds to inquiries. I have to spam text just to find out he has read my message.
- Old notices are not taken down soon enough in elevators or lobby bulletins. It is apparent that there isn't staff that regularly checks the well being of the building/tenants.
- Repairs are announced too soon, giving tenants little to no time to prepare. They tape notices on our apartment doors informing you of boiler repairs that state it will happen "tomorrow", when in reality they put it on your door the same morning of the repair. This is dishonesty.
- The lightbulbs in staircase A, and in the hallway of many floors in the building have been blown out for YEARS. The super and porters are well aware of this issue but don't bother to make the repairs. You would expect them to at least let you see clearly when you are forced to walk the stairs due to the broken elevator.
- People are smoking and doing all sorts of drugs in the staircase. The hallway reeks of those nasty substances sometimes when I walk out of the elevator to my apartment.
- Half of the machines in the laundry room are not working properly. The machines shake violently when in use, and the laundry machines leak water in the back attracting mosquitoes and forming mold. Especially when the weather is warmer, the lobby hallway and laundry room are homes to these pests. Dryer machines are missing handles, and don't even dry!
- The water used to mop the floors in the morning is smelly. No, I am not referring to the chemicals using in the water solution. The mop water being used smells old and dirty. Please do not reuse mop water from previous days, or kindly clean the mop once in awhile.
- The office employers who work on the first floor of the building clearly do not enjoy their jobs. They answer my questions with a miserable tone and couldn't care less about my maintenance needs.
- Recently, there have been hot water issues several times a week, even during peak hours when everyone has to cook and bathe. I shouldn't have to boil water to take a bath.

originalText.text: Low Income Housing but honestly I am tired of reporting the issues in my apartment. This is my 2nd apartment here and this one was rushed with repairs. I really am fed up at this point.
